body.p: comes bundled with a DITA-OT CSS-based PDF Publishing Plugin that combines all the topics from a map or bookmap and styles the resulting document using CSS. It is the base of the and transformation scenarios.

section.title: Transformation Type
section.p: This transformation type uses a CSS-based processing engine and HTML5 as an intermediate format. For this transformation, the pdf-css-html5 transtype is used. Because the structure of the HTML5 intermediate format resembles the one used in WebHelp output, it is possible to reuse parts of your CSS file you developed for a WebHelp customization.

section.title: Transformation Type
section.p: This transformation type uses a CSS-based processing engine and HTML5 as an intermediate format. For this transformation, the pdf-css-html5-single-topic transtype is used. This transformation is derived from but applies on a single topic.

section.title: DITA Map PDF - based on DITA and CSS (WYSIWYG) Transformation Type (Deprecated)
section.p: This transformation type converts DITA maps to PDF using a CSS-based processing engine and a merged DITA map (one with all topics expanded inline) as an intermediate format. For this transformation, the pdf-css transtype is used. This transformation scenario was deprecated starting with version 21.0. It is recommended to use the transformation scenario instead.
